oai_dc:dc.dc:title: PREDICTIVE EQUATIONS REGARDING COASTAL TRANSPORTS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Swart, D.H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: predictive equations
coastal transport
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Morphological changes are the result of gradients in longshore and onshore-offshore sediment transport. The coastal engineer is continually faced with engineering problems in which a quantitative knowledge of these morphological changes is required. For this purpose predictive equations have been developed for both longshore and onshore-offshore sediment transport, which are being used in practical applications. In this paper a few of these predictive techniques, as well as one of their typical applications, viz. to a beachfill problem, will be discussed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 15 (1976): Proceedings of 15th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Honolulu, Hawaii, 1976.; 65
